newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak bank PKB sets SKK 1.0 bln, 4yr bond -Feb 17.
newsitem.headline: Slovak bank PKB sets SKK 1.0 bln, 4yr bond -Feb 17.

text.p: Prva Komunalna Banka (PKB) a.s., Slovakia's ninth largest bank, will launch a one billion crown ($30.9 million) tranche of four-year bonds on February 17, the bank said in a statement on Tuesday.
The bonds, which will have a nominal value of 100,000 crowns, will carry an annual fixed coupon of 12.5 percent.
Last month, Thomson BankWatch assigned PKB a BB+ senior debt rating.
Thomson also assigned an LC-2 short-term local currency debt rating to PKB, saying the bank has been showing favourable financial trends and success as a "niche player."

The three-year old private universal bank, specialising in providing complex services to the municipal sector, has said it also plans to raise its basic capital by 500 million crowns to 1.002 billion, through an issue of non-publicly traded shares, later this year.
The planned equity increase is the first step toward the bank's aim to be granted a licence for providing mortgage loans.
